title: Apply cohesive teal theme across Whisper UI and update hero image (bottom-justified)

requirements.text: Fix and standardize the global design tokens so Tailwind color utilities (e.g., `text-secondary`, `bg-secondary`, `border-secondary`, `ring-secondary`, `bg-accent`) reliably resolve to the intended teal values across the app, eliminating any conflicting/duplicate CSS variable definitions that prevent teal accents from appearing consistently.

quotes: Update the existing Whisper app's frontend design to apply teal styling consistently across elements like the logo, icons, buttons, and other interactive components... Focus only on identifying and modifying the relevant CSS files, Tailwind classes (if used), or design variables to achieve a cohesive teal theme.

acceptanceCriteria: Using `text-secondary`, `bg-secondary`, `border-secondary`, and `ring-secondary` produces teal styling (not default black/white/gray) in both light and dark mode.
No component requires hard-coded color values to achieve teal accents; tokens/variables drive the styling.
Global CSS variables are not defined in multiple conflicting places such that one overrides/breaks the other.

requirements.text: Update frontend styling (Tailwind classes and/or design variables only) so teal accents are applied consistently to the site logo/wordmark, Lucide icons (where not semantic), buttons (including outline/secondary variants), and other interactive elements, without changing component behavior or introducing new UI components.

quotes: Do NOT change any backend logic, canisters, functionality, or existing components beyond styling adjustments.
apply teal styling consistently across elements like the logo, icons, buttons, and other interactive components

acceptanceCriteria: Header brand area (icon + “Whisper” wordmark) clearly renders with teal accents.
Non-semantic Lucide icons across key interactive areas inherit teal styling via `text-secondary` (or equivalent token usage) instead of rendering as default black/white.
Secondary/outline buttons consistently use teal for border/text/hover/focus ring states and do not fall back to non-teal colors.

requirements.text: Replace the hero/header background image with the user-provided image URL and adjust the hero background positioning to be bottom-justified (e.g., `background-position: bottom` / `center bottom`) while preserving existing overlay and text readability.

acceptanceCriteria: The hero section uses the provided image as the background.
The background image is bottom-justified on common viewport sizes (mobile/desktop).
Hero text remains readable against the overlay (no contrast regressions).

requirements.text: Add the new hero image as a static frontend asset under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and reference it from the hero section implementation (do not serve the image from the backend).

quotes: can you use this image... https://storage.basecamp.com/...

acceptanceCriteria: A new static hero image file exists under `frontend/public/assets/generated/`.
The hero section references the local static asset path (not the remote Basecamp URL at runtime).

constraints: Do not change any backend logic, canisters, data models, or backend files.
Do not change functionality or component behavior; make styling-only adjustments (CSS variables, Tailwind classes, design tokens).
Do not edit read-only UI component sources under `frontend/src/components/ui`; style them via tokens, wrappers, or consuming component className overrides.
Keep all user-facing text in English.
nonGoals: No new features, routes, or interactive flows.
No refactors unrelated to styling/theme consistency.
No backend-served asset pipeline; images must remain static frontend assets.
